Name: PERFECTDATA SOFTWARE
Description: Known malicious application used in BEC campaigns. Performs complete mailbox backup and export operations.
AttackMethod: Performs comprehensive mailbox exfiltration. All mailbox data should be considered compromised when this application is detected.

Name: Mail_Backup
Description: Evolved version of PERFECTDATA SOFTWARE. Updated infrastructure for mailbox export operations.
AttackMethod: Comprehensive mailbox exfiltration using Graph API. All mailbox data compromised when detected.

Name: iLSMART
Description: Malicious decoy deployed by Tycoon 2FA phishing kit. Intercepts authentication session cookies.
AttackMethod: AiTM attack via reverse proxy between victim and Microsoft login. Captures passwords, MFA codes, and session cookies.

Name: COZY BEAR OAuth Redirect App
Description: Malicious Azure application created by COZY BEAR (APT29). Single-tenant app hosted in attacker tenant.
AttackMethod: Silent redirect via prompt=none to adversary infrastructure. Detection indicates direct targeting by Russian SVR.

Name: eM Client
Description: Third-party email client frequently abused in consent phishing attacks for mailbox synchronization.
AttackMethod: Establishes persistent access through offline_access scope. Enables complete mailbox synchronization to external systems.

Name: Nine - Email & Calendar
Description: Third-party email client offering full synchronization with offline access capabilities.
AttackMethod: Provides complete mailbox access with persistent token refresh. Used to maintain long-term access to compromised accounts.

Name: TypeApp - Mail & Calendar
Description: Third-party email application known to be abused for persistent email access in phishing campaigns.
AttackMethod: Enables complete mailbox synchronization with persistent access tokens for ongoing data exfiltration.

Name: Edison Mail
Description: Third-party email app that processes email content externally. Used in consent phishing attacks.
AttackMethod: Processes and analyzes email content externally. Persistent access enables ongoing data collection.

Name: Fastmail
Description: Third-party email service that establishes persistent access to corporate mailboxes.
AttackMethod: Establishes long-term persistent access while enabling continuous data exfiltration via offline_access scope.

Name: PostBox
Description: Third-party email client with comprehensive synchronization capabilities used in phishing attacks.
AttackMethod: Provides complete email synchronization infrastructure with persistent token access for mailbox exfiltration.

Name: Spike
Description: Email client with conversational interface. Used by threat actors for rapid mailbox content analysis.
AttackMethod: Restructures email content for rapid analysis. Facilitates quick mailbox review and identification of sensitive communications.

Name: BlueMail
Description: Email client that processes email through external servers. Known to be abused in attacks.
AttackMethod: Routes email through external infrastructure enabling interception and persistent access.

Name: Mailspring
Description: Open-source email client with tracking capabilities. Used in consent phishing campaigns.
AttackMethod: Provides tracking and analytics on email communications. External sync enables data collection.

Name: ZoomInfo
Description: Business intelligence platform that harvests organizational contact and relationship data.
AttackMethod: Harvests organizational contact databases and professional relationship data for external aggregation.

Name: ZoomInfo Credentials
Description: Credential component of ZoomInfo integration for data collection.
AttackMethod: Collects user credentials and profile data for external intelligence gathering operations.

Name: ZoomInfo Communitiez Login
Description: Community-focused variant of ZoomInfo integration for data collection.
AttackMethod: Harvests organizational contact databases and professional relationship graphs for external aggregation.

Name: SigParser
Description: Contact extraction tool that processes email signatures. May facilitate social engineering.
AttackMethod: Scans email content and signatures to extract contact details. Provides intelligence for social engineering attacks.
